SEARCH
Package com.example.yellow.utils

Class FirebaseManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.yellow.utils.FirebaseManager
public class FirebaseManager extends Object
Simple helper for Firebase tasks used by the app:
  • Create events in Firestore
  • Upload poster images to Firebase Storage
  • Query events
  • Patch/update event fields

Use getInstance() to access the singleton.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.CreateEventCallback
    Callback for event creation.
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.GetEventsCallback
    Callback for event query results.
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.SimpleCallback
    Simple callback with success/failure only.
    static interface 
    FirebaseManager.UploadProgressCallback
    Progress updates while uploading a file.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static FirebaseManager getInstance()
      Returns the single shared instance of this manager.
      Returns:
      the FirebaseManager instance

    • createEvent

      public void createEvent(Event event, FirebaseManager.CreateEventCallback callback)
      Creates a new event document in Firestore. If the user is not signed in, signs in anonymously first.
      Parameters:
      event - the event to create
      callback - callback for success or failure

    • uploadImageAndCreateEvent

      public void uploadImageAndCreateEvent(android.net.Uri imageUri, Event event, FirebaseManager.CreateEventCallback callback, FirebaseManager.UploadProgressCallback progressCallback)
      Uploads an image to Firebase Storage and then creates the event in Firestore. If imageUri is null, skips upload and just creates the event.
      Parameters:
      imageUri - the local image to upload (may be null)
      event - the event to create
      callback - callback for create success or failure
      progressCallback - upload progress callback (may be null)

    • getAllEvents

      public void getAllEvents(FirebaseManager.GetEventsCallback callback)
      Loads all events ordered by start date.
      Parameters:
      callback - callback receiving the list of documents or an error

    • getEventsByOrganizer

      public void getEventsByOrganizer(String organizerId, FirebaseManager.GetEventsCallback callback)
      Loads events created by a specific organizer.
      Parameters:
      organizerId - the organizer's user ID
      callback - callback receiving the results or an error

    • updateEvent

      public void updateEvent(@NonNull String docId, @NonNull Map<String,Object> patch, @NonNull FirebaseManager.SimpleCallback cb)
      Partially updates fields on an existing event document.
      Parameters:
      docId - the document ID to update
      patch - map of fields to update
      cb - callback for success or failure

    • updateEventPoster

      public void updateEventPoster(@NonNull String eventId, @NonNull android.net.Uri newImageUri, @NonNull FirebaseManager.SimpleCallback callback, @NonNull FirebaseManager.UploadProgressCallback progressCallback)
      Updates the poster for a specific event. It uploads the new image and then updates the 'posterImageUrl' field in the corresponding Firestore document.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event document to update.
      newImageUri - The local URI of the new poster image.
      callback - A simple callback for success or failure.
      progressCallback - Optional callback for upload progress.

    • getNewEventId

      public String getNewEventId()

    • setEvent

      public void setEvent(String eventId, Event event, FirebaseManager.SimpleCallback callback)
